entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 11 at 10:28AM ChST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WETTER WEATHER POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... This Hydrologic Outlook is for Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A series of passing disturbances could bring periods of heavy rain to the above islands from Monday August 15th to Friday August 19th. Sufficient heavy rain could cause urban and small stream flooding.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 11 at 3:01AM HST until August 11 at 6:00PM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR LEEWARD AREAS TODAY... .The combination of dry fuels, strong and gusty trade winds, and low relative humidity will result in critical fire conditions at times today. Any fires that develop could display extreme fire behavior and be difficult to control. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Sublette County through 400 PM MDT... At 323 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Warren Bridge, or 19 miles west of Pinedale, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Green River Basin; Upper Green River Basin Foothills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Rich...east central Morgan...northwestern Summit and southwestern Uinta Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Coalville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wyoming, including the following county, Albany. This includes areas near Foxpark. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
